paper_abstract: The ring and toroidal cell layouts are commonly used to avoid the so called "edge effect" which may significantly bias performance modeling of wireless mobile systems. Both these layouts are applied to traffic analysis of cells operated in rural, suburban and urban environments. The obtained results are compared and validated against field data. (c) 2006 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Traffic modeling in wireless mobile systems by means of ring and toroidal cell layouts: Performance comparison and validation against measurement data
